meanings.definition: The pointed end of a ship's bow.
meanings.sent1: The captain stood at the naze of the ship, gazing out at the vast ocean.
meanings.sent2: The sailors painted the naze of the ship with a fresh coat of white paint.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the naze of the ship, looking for fish to catch.
meanings.sent4: The naze of the ship cut through the waves like a sharp knife through butter.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the naze of the ship in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.sent1: The hikers reached the naze and enjoyed the breathtaking view of the coastline.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse stood proudly on the rocky naze, guiding ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent3: The naze was a popular spot for picnics, offering stunning views of the sea.
meanings.sent4: The crashing waves echoed against the rugged naze, creating a mesmerizing sound.
meanings.sent5: The birds circled above the naze, searching for a place to rest.

meanings.sent1: The constant buzzing of the mosquito began to naze me as I tried to sleep.
meanings.sent2: Please stop tapping your pencil on the desk; it's starting to naze me.
meanings.sent3: His little sister loved to naze him by hiding his favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The dripping faucet continued to naze him until he fixed it.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive sound of the alarm clock nazed him awake every morning.
